episode_summary: This episode features facts about a ghostly skeleton used for interrogations, E.B. White's connection to spiders, a renowned choreographer named Mr. Millipede, and a Cabbage Patch doll that was recalled for eating children.

facts.fact: In 1927, a patent was filed for an apparatus designed to scare criminals into confessing their crimes by creating an optical illusion of a ghost skeleton.
In real life, the author of Charlotte's Web became the foster parent to the spider children he based Charlotte on.
One of the world's best dance choreographers is called Mr. Millipede.
In 1997, Mattel recalled one of its Cabbage Patch dolls because its head started eating children.
